VR Performance Notes: Virt-A-Mate will push the limit of any CPU/GPU when played in VR. You should expect the scene animation to update at 30fps maximum (although turning your head will generally still refresh at 90fps to prevent VR nausea). If the game slows down as you create your desired scene, try any or all of the following:
1) Run vamX Menu -> Plugins Tab -> Give Me FPS -> Standard (as explained in the main in-game tutorial).
2) Turn off soft-body physics, disable mirrored surfaces, or lower the same graphics quality setting, in the Virt-A-Mate Menu -> Main UI (3 horizontal bars) -> User Preferences tab -> Performance Tab.
3) Remove clothes using the Clothes & Hair tab.
4) Hide the Male, so that only the Female is shown, or reduce the number of people in the scene if using more than 2 people.
5) Switch to the simple black scene to remove the environment and focus on the action (1st item on the 2nd page of Scene).
